intro: Cyathopsis violaceospicata, commonly known as the violet spiculate cyathopsis, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive violet-colored bracts. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. Its flowers are hermaphroditic, with both male and female reproductive structures. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
